verbs.description: formulate (third-person singular simple present formulates, present participle formulating, simple past and past participle formulated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put into a clear and definite form of statement or expression.
examples: Another source of evidence supporting the conclusion that children learn language by formulating a set of rules comes from the errors that they produce. A case in point are overgeneralized past tense forms like comed, goed, seed, buyed, bringed, etc. frequently used by young children.
